meanings.definition: To strike repeatedly with the fists
meanings.sent1: He was pummelling the punching bag at the gym.
meanings.sent2: The boxer was pummelling his opponent in the ring.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretended to be a superhero, pummelling imaginary villains.
meanings.sent4: The rain pummelling against the window sounded like a drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The waves pummelling the shore created a mesmerizing rhythm.

meanings.definition: A series of heavy blows or strikes
meanings.sent1: The pummelling of the hammer on the metal echoed through the workshop.
meanings.sent2: The wrestler received a relentless pummelling from his opponent.
meanings.sent3: The pummelling rain on the roof made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent4: The pummelling of the waves against the cliff eroded it over time.
meanings.sent5: The constant pummelling of the wind against the tent kept them awake all night.

meanings.sent1: She was pummelling the dough to make the perfect bread.
meanings.sent2: The storm was pummelling the city with heavy rain and strong winds.
meanings.sent3: The chef was pummelling the ingredients together to create a delicious sauce.
meanings.sent4: The angry waves seemed to pummel the boat as it struggled in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The drummers pummelled the drums with great energy during the performance.
